reviews.review:
*slow clap* Oh good, that's still working. lol Wow, I just can't say enough good things about this game! I loved the first Portal and have repeatedly played it over the years I've owned it. Portal 2 stepped things up about 10 notches. Not only are the puzzles challanging and the co-op mode a blast but it's legitimately funny. Glados no longer tries to hide or ignore her emotions and so the character development and interactions are by far my favorite aspect of this game. She's such a snarky little bitch and I love her so. It's subtle and you have to look closely for it, but you also learn how Chell ended up a test subject in this game, too, which is nice to know. 

My favorite part, without a doubt, is getting to traverse the lower sections of Apeture and learning about/listening to Cave Johnson. Again, that stuff is so freaking funny and twisted. I highly recommend playing the first game before this one due to how good they both are and so you get all the references but if you haven't played it that's okay as the game does a great job explaining things so you won't end up lost.
Brilliant.

"And then she turns herself into a potato, and says "I'm a potatOS". Funniest shit I've ever heard."

I mean, what is there to say about Portal 2 that hasn't already been said?

It's such a great sequel to an already fantastic game, that expands upon the lore, gameplay, and world in such an interesting and entertaining way (Cave Johnson is a legend). The campaign is solid, both solo or with friends, and the workshop support is a fun addition that shows how creative people can get with the basic yet ingenious premise alone. Buy it if you haven't already.
so much fun and laughter. must get and play with friends.

Gioco fantastico per gli amanti dei puzzle, gira bene su computer lenti, ha una campagna stupenda e una rigiocabilitÃ  alle stelle grazie alla cooperativa ed alle mappe della comunitÃ .

Campagna coop ultra consigliata; a mio avviso, una delle migliori da giocare con un amico in chiamata vocale.
Uno dei giochi che consiglio maggiormente.

Portal 2 is an awesome game with mind blowing stunts, realistic physics, stellar voice acting, beautifully crafted soundtrack, and one of the best co-op campaigns for any game ever. Do not miss this game if you are a fan of puzzles, narrative, co-op games. It will provide hours of fun. Also exclusively to PC, there is a level editor where you can design your own tests or play tests created by others, providing tons of replayabilty.This game is one of Valve's finest works and a game not worth missing.

P.S. I personally perfer the portal series to the half life series, but that might just be me because I'm a puzzle kind of guy.
The cake might be a lie but it doesn't change the fact that this game is one of the best and most original games of all time.
Recommend

I just want to start by saying I'm a huge puzzle game nerd, and have a really hard time finding games that challenge me. Portal 2 was successful in doing this, which makes me rather bias in my opinion of it.

But really, I absolutely, positively adore this game. The story line was cute and funny. The puzzles are challenging, but if you can stick through it all without cheating, it's very rewarding. I played Portal 2 before I played Portal (I have since beat #1), and Portal 2 FAR surprasses Portal in every light. 

Buy the game, it's fantastic.

One of my top 3 favorite games, hands down. I couldn't get enough. The combination of puzzle-solving and incessant dry humor is unmatched and will keep you constantly craving more. Such a long trek of a game but I never wanted it to end.

Luckily, it didn't have to, because once I beat it, I started creating my own chambers and playing other peoples'.

Can't wait for another sequel.

My friend introduced me to portal 2. 

A good chunk of hours was used over the next few days and then we completed the multiplayer courses.

This game is a lot of fun!

Especially when you screw up a whole bunch of times and then keep dying. Then you die of laughter. 

Highly recommend when you want a new game to try with a friend.

Portal 2 is a wonderful game. The addition of one more main character to the storyline really brings life to the story. The character development is great for all characters involved. 
The gameplay is a lot of fun, co-op mode being very fun too. The addition of new testing elements makes Portal 2 as a sequel warranted, rather than an addition to the original game. 
The dark humor is back, and it gives Portal 2 a similar tone to the original, but it's certainly not an identical tone. The soundtrack and the mutability of the test chambers gives Portal 2 a much different feel from old rusted test labs of Portal. The new tone is by no means a bad thing, but there's something lacking in it that prevents Portal 2 from achieving the same emotions as Portal did. 
But play this game! Please!
Super enjoyable to play, and even just to watch!

If this game was a chocolate cake, it would be a good chocolate cake.
[spoiler] Just kidding, the cake is a lie [/spoiler]
Anyway, here is how to make your very own portal 2 chocolate cake. 
1 (18.25-ounce) package chocolate cake mix
1 can prepared coconutâ€“pecan frosting
3/4 cup vegetable oil
4 large eggs
1 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips
3/4 cup butter or margarine
1 2/3 cup granulated sugar
2 cups all-purpose flour
Don't forget garnishes such as:
Fish-shaped crackers
Fish-shaped candies
Fish-shaped solid waste
Fish-shaped dirt
Fish-shaped ethylbenzene
Pull-and-peel licorice
Fish-shaped volatile organic compounds and sediment-shaped sediment
Candy-coated peanut butter pieces (shaped like fish)
1 cup lemon juice
Alpha resins
Unsaturated polyester resin
Fiberglass surface resins and volatile malted milk impoundments
9 large egg yolks
12 medium geosynthetic membranes
1 cup granulated sugar
An entry called: "How to Kill Someone with Your Bare Hands"
2 cups rhubarb, sliced
2/3 cups granulated rhubarb
1 tbsp. all-purpose rhubarb
1 tsp. grated orange rhubarb
3 tbsp. rhubarb, on fire
1 large rhubarb
1 cross borehole electromagnetic imaging rhubarb
2 tbsp. rhubarb juice
Adjustable aluminum head positioner
Slaughter electric needle injector
Cordless electric needle injector
Injector needle driver
Injector needle gun
Cranial caps
And it contains proven preservatives, deep-penetration agents, and gas- and odor-control chemicals that will deodorize and preserve putrid tissue. 

Now for the steps, 
1.) Gather your ingredients
2.) Preheat the oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit.
3.) Grease your cake pan.
4.) Mix the wet ingredients in a large bowl. [spoiler]The "wet ingredients" in cake recipes are generally those that have moisture. [/spoiler]
5.) Mix the dry ingredients in a separate bowl. 
6.) Add the dry mixture to the wet mixture. Beat the mixture on low until the batter comes together and no white bits of flour remain.
7.) Pour the batter into the cake pan.
8.) Put the pan in the oven and bake the cake for 30 minutes.
9.) Take the cake from the oven and let it cool.
10.) Invert the cake onto a plate.
11.) Let the cake cool completely before frosting.
Now the final and most important step,  
[spoiler]Cry in despair as GLaDOS steals the cake from you.[/spoiler]

10/10

Okay, this game is AWESOME. If you thought it wasn't as good as your precious CoD, then, fine, miss out on a REAL game.
AMAZING writing, critical thinking, greatly-designed puzzles, Steam workshop, likeable (and hate-able) characters, and a well-made difficulty and learning curve come together to make one of the best games/pieces of art of all time, and let you enjoy what non-gamers miss out on. This game... is awesome. 
-WARNING- 
This game will fill your mind with:
a love of puzzles
witty comebacks
a list of paradoxes
interest in AI technology
empathy for a certain British core
pre-recorded messages for the apocalypse
knowledge
a heightened IQ (on behalf of the game, you're welcome)
